message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.NE

The paper is about speech separation using deep neural networks, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and speech processing. The most likely sub-category is cs.SD (Sound), which specifically deals with audio and speech processing. The paper also uses convolutional neural networks (CNN) and long short-term memory (LSTM), which are commonly used in computer vision and sequential data processing, respectively. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also proposes a new training objective and uses permutation invariant training (PIT), which are related to machine learning and optimization, respectively. Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) are also possible sub-categories.
